inspirationalQuotes.text: The good physician treats the disease; the great physician treats the patient who has the disease.
inspirationalQuotes.author: William Osler

inspirationalQuotes.text: Wherever the art of medicine is loved, there is also a love of humanity.
inspirationalQuotes.author: Hippocrates

inspirationalQuotes.text: The chapter you are learning today is going to save someone's life tomorrow. Pay attention.
inspirationalQuotes.author: Unknown

paretoBanner.title: Master the 80/20 Rule
paretoBanner.description: Focus on the 20% of topics that will yield 80% of your exam results. Study smarter, not just harder. Prioritize high-yield concepts to maximize your score.

questionOfTheDay.question: A 55-year-old male presents with sudden-onset chest pain. An ECG shows ST-segment elevation in leads II, III, and aVF. Which coronary artery is most likely occluded?

subjects.name: Anatomy
subjects.description: Anatomy is the cornerstone of medical science, exploring the intricate structure of the human body. This foundational subject provides a comprehensive map, from macroscopic organ systems to microscopic cellular details. Understanding anatomy is crucial for diagnosis, surgery, and all clinical practices.

subjects.name: Physiology
subjects.description: Physiology explains how the body works. It’s about the functions and mechanisms, from molecular to whole-body levels, that keep us alive and responding to our environment.

subjects.name: Biochemistry
subjects.description: Biochemistry is the study of chemical processes within and relating to living organisms. It's the language of life, translating biology into chemistry to understand everything from DNA to metabolism.

subjects.name: Pathology
subjects.description: Pathology is the bridge between science and medicine. It underpins every aspect of patient care, from diagnostic testing and treatment advice to using cutting-edge genetic technologies.

subjects.name: Microbiology
subjects.description: Microbiology is the study of all living organisms that are too small to be visible with the naked eye. This includes bacteria, archaea, viruses, fungi, prions, protozoa and algae, collectively known as 'microbes'.

subjects.name: Pharmacology
subjects.description: Pharmacology is the science of drugs and their effects on living systems. It explores how medicines work, their side effects, and how they are used to treat diseases.

textbooks.title: Goodman & Gilman's: The Pharmacological Basis of Therapeutics
textbooks.author: Laurence L. Brunton

subjects.name: Community Medicine
subjects.description: Community Medicine focuses on the health of populations. It aims to protect and improve the health of communities through education, policy-making, and research for disease and injury prevention.

subjects.name: Forensic Medicine
subjects.description: Forensic Medicine is where law and medicine intersect. It involves the application of medical knowledge to legal questions, playing a crucial role in the investigation of death, injury, and disease.

subjects.name: ENT
subjects.description: Otorhinolaryngology (ENT) is the surgical subspecialty that deals with conditions of the ear, nose, and throat, and related structures of the head and neck. It’s a diverse field, with a wide range of procedures.

subjects.name: Ophthalmology
subjects.description: Ophthalmology is the branch of medicine that deals with the anatomy, physiology, and diseases of the eyeball and orbit. It's a field at the forefront of medical technology and surgical innovation.

subjects.name: General Medicine
subjects.description: General Medicine is the medical specialty dedicated to the diagnosis and medical treatment of adults. General physicians are skilled in managing patients with multi-system disease processes.

subjects.name: General Surgery
subjects.description: General Surgery is a surgical specialty that focuses on abdominal contents including esophagus, stomach, small bowel, colon, liver, pancreas, gallbladder, appendix and bile ducts, and often the thyroid gland.

subjects.name: Obstetrics & Gynaecology
subjects.description: Obstetrics and Gynaecology (O&G) is the medical specialty that encompasses the two subspecialties of obstetrics (covering pregnancy, childbirth, and the postpartum period) and gynaecology (covering the health of the female reproductive system).

subjects.name: Pediatrics
subjects.description: Pediatrics is the branch of medicine that involves the medical care of infants, children, and adolescents. The American Academy of Pediatrics recommends people be under pediatric care up to the age of 21.

subjects.name: Orthopedics
subjects.description: Orthopedics is the branch of surgery concerned with conditions involving the musculoskeletal system. Orthopedic surgeons use both surgical and nonsurgical means to treat musculoskeletal trauma, spine diseases, sports injuries, degenerative diseases, infections, tumors, and congenital disorders.

subjects.name: Radiology
subjects.description: Radiology is the medical discipline that uses medical imaging to diagnose and treat diseases within the bodies of animals and humans. A variety of imaging techniques such as X-ray radiography, ultrasound, computed tomography (CT), nuclear medicine including positron emission tomography (PET), and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) are used to diagnose or treat diseases.

subjects.name: Anesthesiology
subjects.description: Anesthesiology, anaesthesiology, or anaesthesia is the medical specialty concerned with the total perioperative care of patients before, during and after surgery. It encompasses anesthesia, intensive care medicine, critical emergency medicine, and pain medicine.

subjects.name: Psychiatry
subjects.description: Psychiatry is the medical specialty devoted to the diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of mental disorders. These include various maladaptations related to mood, behaviour, cognition, and perceptions.

subjects.name: Dermatology
subjects.description: Dermatology is the branch of medicine dealing with the skin. It is a specialty with both medical and surgical aspects. A dermatologist is a specialist medical doctor who manages diseases related to skin, hair and nails and some cosmetic problems.

subjects.name: Oncology
subjects.description: Oncology is a branch of medicine that deals with the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of cancer. A medical professional who practices oncology is an oncologist.

textbooks.title: DeVita, Hellman, and Rosenberg's Cancer: Principles & Practice of Oncology
textbooks.author: Vincent T. DeVita Jr.

subjects.name: Cardiology
subjects.description: Cardiology is a branch of medicine that deals with the disorders of the heart as well as some parts of the circulatory system. The field includes medical diagnosis and treatment of congenital heart defects, coronary artery disease, heart failure, valvular heart disease and electrophysiology.

textbooks.title: Braunwald's Heart Disease: A Textbook of Cardiovascular Medicine
textbooks.author: Douglas L. Mann
